DataElement.preferredDefinition: Laterality of (paired) body part examined. Required if the body part examined is a paired structure and Image Laterality (0020,0062) or Frame Laterality (0020,9072) are not sent. Note: Some IODs support Image Laterality (0020,0062) at the Image level or Frame Laterality(0020,9072) at the Frame level in the Frame Anatomy functional group macro, which can provide a more comprehensive mechanism for specifying thelaterality of the body part(s) being examined.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Laterality of (paired) body part examined. Required if the body part examined is a paired structure and Image Laterality (0020,0062) or Frame Laterality (0020,9072) are not sent. Note: Some IODs support Image Laterality (0020,0062) at the Image level or Frame Laterality(0020,9072) at the Frame level in the Frame Anatomy functional group macro, which can provide a more comprehensive mechanism for specifying thelaterality of the body part(s) being examined.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:A number of things or events standing or succeeding in order, and connected by a like relation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A group or succession of objects, substances, or events arranged in regular order in space or time, connected by a like relation, or forming a kind of chain.

Property.preferredDefinition: A set of two similar things considered as a unit.:Behavioral manifestations of cerebral dominance in which there is preferential use and superior functioning of either the left or the right side, as in the preferred use of the right hand or right foot.

Concepts.definition: A set of two similar things considered as a unit.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/19/09 superseded; replace OC with Image Series (2436196); added concept for paired

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representating a side of the body or of a structure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Behavioral manifestations of cerebral dominance in which there is preferential use and superior functioning of either the left or the right side, as in the preferred use of the right hand or right foot.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  9/16/07  DEC created to support DICOM task utilizing IE & DICOM Attribute terms.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/19/09 created to reflect change to Image Series OC (2436196) per VCDE NCIA interim report.
